dataitem.name: Data Source Identifier
dataitem.definition: Identification of the system sending the data

dataitem.name: Service Identification
dataitem.definition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.

dataitem.name: Track Number
dataitem.definition: Identification of a track

dataitem.name: Mode-3/A Code in Octal Representation
dataitem.definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

dataitem.name: Time of Track Information
dataitem.definition: Absolute time stamping of the information provided in the track message, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
dataitem.desc:
Notes
1. This is the time of the track state vector.
2. The time is reset to zero at every midnight.

dataitem.name: Track Status
dataitem.definition: Status of track.

field.name: SPI
field.enum: SPI present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data

field.name: SRC
field.desc: Source of calculated track altitude for I062/130

field.name: TSE
field.enum: track service end (i.e. last message transmitted to the user for the track).

field.name: TSB
field.enum: track service begin (i.e. first message transmitted to the user for the track)

field.name: AFF
field.enum: ADS-B data inconsistent with other surveillance information

field.name: AMA
field.enum: track not resulting from amalgamation process

field.name: ME
field.enum: Military Emergency present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data

field.name: MI
field.enum: Military identification present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data

field.name: CST
field.enum: Age of the last received track update is higher than system dependent threshold (coasting)

field.name: PSR
field.enum: Default value Age of the last received PSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold

field.name: SSR
field.enum: Age of the last received SSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold

field.name: MDS
field.enum: Age of the last received Mode S track update is higher than system dependent threshold

field.name: ADS
field.enum: Age of the last received ADS-B track update is higher than system dependent threshold

field.name: SUC
field.enum: Special Used Code (Mode A codes to be defined in the system to mark a track with special interest)

field.name: AAC
field.enum: Assigned Mode A Code Conflict (same discrete Mode A Code assigned to another track)

dataitem.desc:
Notes
1. Track type and coasting can also be derived from I062/290 System Track Update Ages
2. If the system supports the technology, default value (0) means that the technology was used to produce the report
3. If the system does not support the technology, default value is meaningless.

dataitem.name: Calculated Track Position. (Cartesian)
dataitem.definition: Calculated position in Cartesian co-ordinates with a resolution of 0.5m, in two’s complement form.

dataitem.name: Calculated Position In WGS-84 Co-ordinates
dataitem.definition: Calculated Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates with a resolution of 180/2^25 . degrees

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^25 degrees

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ longitude < 180 deg. = 180/2^25 degrees

dataitem.desc: NoteThe LSB B provides a resolution at least better than 0.6m.

dataitem.name: Mode 5 Data reports and Extended Mode 1 Code
dataitem.definition: Mode 5 Data reports and Extended Mode 1 Code

subfield.name: Mode 5 Summary

field.name: DA
field.enum: No authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)

field.name: M1
field.enum: Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply

field.name: M2
field.enum: Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply

field.name: M3
field.enum: Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply

field.name: MC
field.enum: Mode C code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C code from Mode 5 reply.

field.name: X
field.enum: X-pulse received.set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report
field.desc: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report.

subfield.desc:
Note
1. The flags M2, M3, MC refer to the contents of data items I062/120, I062/060 and I062/135 respectively. The flag M1 refers to the contents of the Subfield #5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation).
2. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Emergency bit set, then the Military Emergency bit (ME) in Data Item I062/080, Track Status, shall be set.
3. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Identification of Position bit set, then the Special Position Identification bit (SPI) in Data Item I062/080, Track Status, shall be set.

subfield.name: Mode 5 Reported Position

field.name: Latitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees

field.name: Longitude
field.desc: In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ latitude < 180 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees

subfield.desc:
Note
The resolution implied by the LSB is better than the resolution with which Mode 5 position reports are transmitted from aircraft transponders using currently defined formats.

subfield.name: Mode 5 GNSS-derived Altitude

field.name: RES
field.desc: Resolution with which the GNSS-derived Altitude (GA) is reported.

field.name: GA
field.desc: GNSS-derived ellipsoid. Altitude of target, expressed as height above WGS 84

subfield.desc:
NOTES
1. GA is coded as a 14-bit two’s complement binary number with an LSB of 25 ft. irrespective of the setting of RES.
2. The minimum value of GA that can be reported is -1000 ft.

subfield.name: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation

field.name: EM1
field.desc: Extended Mode 1 Code in octal representation

subfield.desc:
NOTES
If Subfield #1 is present, the M1 bit in Subfield #1 indicates whether the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 5 reply or a Mode 1 reply. If Subfield #1 is not present, the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 1 reply.

subfield.name: Time Offset for POS and GA

field.name: TOS
field.desc: Time Offset coded as a twos complement number with an LSB of 1/128 s. The time at which the Mode 5 Reported Position (Subfield #3) and Mode 5 GNSS-derived Altitude (Subfield #4) are valid is given by Time of Day (I048/140) plus Time Offset.

subfield.desc:
NOTES
TOS shall be assumed to be zero if Subfield #6 is not present.

field.name: X5
field.desc: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report.
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received.

field.name: XC
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply

field.name: X3
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply

field.name: X2
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply

field.name: X1
field.enum: X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

dataitem.name: Track Mode 2 Code
dataitem.definition: Mode 2 code associated to the track

dataitem.name: Calculated Track Geometric Altitude
dataitem.definition: Vertical distance between the target and the projection of its position on the earth’s ellipsoid, as defined by WGS84, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO
2. The source of altitude is identified in bits (SRC) of item I062/080 Track Status

dataitem.name: Calculated Track Barometric Altitude
dataitem.definition: Calculated Barometric Altitude of the track, in two’s complement form.

field.name: Calculated Track Barometric Altitude
field.desc: (LSB) = 1/4 FL = 25 ft, Vmin = -15 FL, Vmax = 1500 FL

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
ICAO specifies a range between –10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C

dataitem.name: Measured Flight Level
dataitem.definition: Last valid and credible flight level used to update the track, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The criteria to determine the credibility of the flight level are Tracker dependent.
2. Credible means: within reasonable range of change with respect to the previous detection.
3. ICAO specifies a range between –10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C
4. This item includes the barometric altitude received from ADS-B

dataitem.name: Calculated Track Velocity (Cartesian)
dataitem.definition: Calculated track velocity expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the target.

dataitem.name: Track Status
dataitem.definition: Status of track.
dataitem.desc:
NOTE
The ADF, if set, indicates that a difference has been detected in the altitude information derived from radar as compared to other technologies (such as ADS-B).

dataitem.name: Calculated Acceleration (Cartesian)
dataitem.definition: Calculated Acceleration of the target expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates, in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the target.
2. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

dataitem.name: Calculated Rate Of Climb/Descent
dataitem.definition: Calculated rate of Climb/Descent of an aircraft in two’s complement form.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
A positive value indicates a climb, whereas a negative value indicates a descent.

dataitem.name: Target identification
dataitem.definition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters.

field.name: STI
field.enum: Callsign or registration downlinked from transponder

field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining target identification.

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. For coding, see section 3.8.2.9 of [Ref.3]
2. As the Callsign of the target can already be transmitted (thanks to I062/380 Subfield #25 if downlinked from the aircraft or thanks to I062/390 Subfield #2 if the target is correlated to a flight plan), and in order to avoid confusion at end user’s side, this item SHALL not be used.

dataitem.name: Target Size and Orientation
dataitem.definition: Target size defined as length and width of the detected target, and orientation.
dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. The orientation gives the direction which the target nose is pointing to, relative to the Geographical North.
2. When the length only is sent, the largest dimension is provided.

dataitem.name: System Track Update Ages
dataitem.definition: Ages of the last plot/local track/target report update for each sensor type.

field.name: TRK
field.desc: Actual track age since first occurence, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: PSR
field.desc: Age of the last primary detection used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: SSR
field.desc: Age of the last secondary detection used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: MDS
field.desc: Age of the last Mode S detection used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: ADS
field.desc: Age of the last ADS-C report used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Max. value = 16383.75s (> 4 hours)

field.name: ES
field.desc: Age of the last 1090 Extended Squitter ADS-B report used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: VDL
field.desc: Age of the last VDL Mode-4-ADS-B report used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: UAT
field.desc: Age of the last UAT ADS-B report used to update the track, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: LOP
field.desc: Age of the last magnetic loop detection, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

field.name: MLT
field.desc: Age of the last MLT detection, (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value = 63.75s

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
1. Except for Track Age, the ages are counted from Data Item I062/070, Time Of Track Information, using the following formula: Age = Time of track information - Time of last detection used to update the track
2. The time of last detection is derived from monosensor category time of day
3. If the data has never been received, then the corresponding subfield is not sent.
4. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

dataitem.name: Track Data Ages
dataitem.definition: Ages of the data provided.

field.name: MFL
field.desc: Age of the last valid and credible Mode C code or barometric altitude from ADS-B used to update the track (I062/136). (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MD1
field.desc: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 1 used to update the track (I062/110). (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MD2
field.desc: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 2 used to update the track (I062/120). (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MDA
field.desc: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 3/A used to update the track (I062/060). (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MD4
field.desc: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 4 used to update the track. (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MD5
field.desc: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 5 used to update the track (I062/110). (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MHG
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Magnetic Heading” in item 062/380 (Subfield #3) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

subfield.name: Indicated Airspeed / Mach Nb age

field.name: IAS
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Indicated Airspeed / Mach Number” in item 062/380 (Subfield #4) Maximum value = 63.75s

subfield.desc:
NOTES
Despite there are now two subfields (#29 and #30) reporting the ages of, respectively, the Indicated Airspeed track data and the Mach Number track data, this former subfield is kept free in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 062 already implemented.

field.name: TAS
field.desc: Age of the DAP “True Airspeed” in item 062/380 (Subfield #5) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: SAL
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Selected Altitude” in item 062/380 (Subfield #6) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: FSS
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Final State Selected Altitude” in item 062/380 (Subfield #7) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: TID
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Trajectory Intent” in item 062/380 (Subfield #8) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

subfield.name: Communication/ACAS Capability and Flight Status Age

field.name: COM
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Communication/ACAS Capability and Flight Status” in item 062/380 (Subfield #10) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: SAB
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Status Reported by ADS-B” in item 062/380 (Subfield #11) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: ACS
field.desc: Age of the DAP “ACAS Resolution Advisory Report” in item 062/380 (Subfield #12) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: BVR
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Barometric Vertical Rate” in item 062/380 (Subfield #13) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: GVR
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Geometrical Vertical Rate” in item 062/380 (Subfield #14) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: RAN
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Roll Angle” in item 062/380 (Subfield #15) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: TAR
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Track Angle Rate” in item 062/380 (Subfield #16) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: TAN
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Track Angle” in item 062/380 (Subfield #17) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: GSP
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Ground Speed” in item 062/380 (Subfield #18) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: VUN
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Velocity Uncertainty” in item 062/380 (Subfield #19) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MET
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Meteorological Data” in item 062/380 (Subfield #20) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: EMC
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Emitter Category” in item 062/380 (Subfield #21) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: POS
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Position” in item 062/380 (Subfield #23) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: GAL
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Geometric Altitude” in item 062/380 (Subfield #24) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: PUN
field.desc: Age of the in DAP item “Position 062/380 Uncertainty” (Subfield #25) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MB
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Mode S MB Data” in item 062/380 (Subfield #22) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: IAR
field.desc: Age of the “Airspeed” in (Subfield #26) DAP “Indicated” item 062/380 (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: MAC
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Mach Number” in item 062/380 (Subfield #27) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

field.name: BPS
field.desc: Age of the DAP “Barometric Pressure Setting” in item 062/380 (Subfield #28) (LSB) = 1/4 s, Maximum value =63.75s

dataitem.desc:
NOTES
In all the subfields, the age is the time delay since the value was measured

dataitem.name: Vehicle Fleet Identification
dataitem.definition: Vehicle fleet identification number.

dataitem.name: Mode 5 Data reports and Extended Mode 1 Code
dataitem.definition: All measured data related to the last report used to update the track. These data are not used for ADS-B.

subfield.name: Sensor Identifier

field.name: SAC
field.desc: System Area Code fixed to zero

subfield.desc:
Note
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int).

subfield.name: Measured Position in Polar Co-ordinates
subfield.description: Measured position of a target in local polar co-ordinates.

field.name: RHO
field.desc: Measured distance: (LSB) = 1/256 NN, Maximum value = 256 NM

field.name: Last Measured Mode C Code, in two's complement form

subfield.name: Last Measured Mode 3/A Code

field.name: L
field.enum: MODE of the 3/A code as derived from the reply transponder.
MODE 3/A Smoothed code as provided by a sensor local tracker.

field.name: Reply
field.desc: Mode 3/A reply under the form of 4 digits in octal representation

subfield.desc:
Note
Smoothed MODE 3/A data (L = 1) will be used in case of absence of MODE 3/A code information in the plot or in case of difference between plot and sensor local track MODE 3/A code information.

dataitem.name: Aircraft Derived Data
dataitem.definition: Data derived directly by the aircraft.

field.name: Target Address
field.desc: 24 bits Target Address, A23 to A0

field.name: Ident
field.desc: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining a target identification when flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available. Coding rules are provided in [3] Section 3.8.2.9

subfield.name: Indicated Airspeed / Mach No
subfield.desc:
Note
Despite there are now two subfields (#26 and #27) reporting, respectively, the Indicated Airspeed track data and the Mach Number track data, this former subfield is kept free in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 062 already implemented.

subfield.name: Selected Altitude
subfield.definition: The short-term vertical intent as described by either the FMS selected altitude, the Altitude Control Panel Selected Altitude (FCU/MCP), or the current aircraft altitude according to the aircraft's mode of flight.

field.name: Altitude
field.desc:
Altitude in two’s complement form
LSB=25ft
-1300ft ≤ Altitude ≤ 100000ft

subfield.name: Final State Selected Altitude
subfield.definition: The vertical intent value that corresponds with the ATC cleared altitude, as derived from the Altitude Control Panel (FCU/MCP).

field.name: Altitude
field.desc:
Altitude in two’s complement form
LSB=25ft
-1300ft ≤ Altitude ≤ 100000ft

field.name: NAV
field.enum: Trajectory Intent Data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not available for this aircraft

field.name: NVB
field.enum: Trajectory Intent Data is not valid

field.name: Latitude
field.desc:
In WGS.84 in two’s complement.
-90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg.
LSB = 180/2^23 deg. = approx.2.145767*10^-05 deg.

field.name: Longitude
field.desc:
In WGS.84 in two’s complement.
-180 ≤ longitude ≤ 180 deg.
LSB = 180/2^23 deg. = approx.2.145767*10^-05 deg.

field.name: TTR
field.desc:
TCP Turn radius
LSB = 0.01Nm
0 ≤ TTR ≤ 655.35 Nm

subfield.desc:
Note
1. NC is set to one when the aircraft will not fly the path described by the TCP data.
2. TCP numbers start from zero.
3. LT = Lateral Type
4. VT = Vertical Type
5. TOV gives the estimated time before reaching the point. It is defined as theabsolute time from midnight.
6. TOV meaningful only if TOA is set to 0

subfield.name: Communications/ACAS Capability and Flight Status reported by Mode-S

field.name: COM
field.enum: Comm. A and Comm. B capability
Comm. A, Comm. B and Uplink ELM
Comm. A, Comm. B, Uplink ELM and Downlink ELM

field.name: STAT
field.enum: No alert, no SPI, aircraft airborne
No alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
No alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground

field.name: GBS
field.enum: Transponder Ground Bit not set or unknown

subfield.name: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report
subfield.definition: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the report and threat identity data.

field.name: MB Data
field.desc: 56-bit message conveying Mode S Comm B message data of BDS Register 3,0

subfield.desc:
Note
Refer to ICAO Draft SARPs for ACAS for detailed explanations.

field.name: Barometric Vertical Rate
field.desc:
Barometric Vertical Rate in two’s complement form
(LSB) = 6.25 feet/minute

field.name: Geometric Vertical Rate
field.desc:
Geometric Vertical Rate in two’s complement form
(LSB) = 6.25 feet/minute

field.name: Roll Angle
field.desc:
Roll Angle in two’s complement form
(LSB) = 0.01 degree -180 ≤ Roll Angle ≤ 180

subfield.name: Track Angle Rate

field.name: Rate of Turn
field.desc:
Rate of Turn in two’s complement form
(LSB) = 2^-2°/s = 1/4°/s
-15 °/s ≤ Rate of Turn ≤ 15°/s

subfield.desc:
Note
1. A positive value represents a right turn, whereas a negative value represents a left turn.
2. Value 15 means 15°/s or above.

field.name: Ground Speed
field.desc:
Ground Speed in two's complement form referenced to WGS84
(LSB) = 2^-14 NM/s = 0.22 kt
-2 NM/s ≤ Ground Speed < 2 NM/s

subfield.name: Velocity Uncertainty
subfield.desc:
Note
Velocity uncertainty category of the least accurate velocity component

field.name: ECAT
field.enum: highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (>400 knots cruise)

subfield.name: Position

field.name: Latitude
field.desc:
In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees = 2.145767 * 10^-05 degrees.
This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2.4 meters

field.name: Longitude
field.desc:
In WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ latitude < 180 deg. LSB = 180/2^23 degrees = 2.145767 * 10-05 degrees.
This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2.4 meters.

subfield.desc:
Note
Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North.

subfield.name: Geometric Altitude

field.name: Altitude
field.desc:
Altitude in two’s complement form
-1500 ft ≤ Altitude ≤ 150000 ft (LSB) = 6.25 ft

subfield.desc:
NOTES
LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO

subfield.name: Mode S MB Data

field.name: MB Data
field.desc: 56-bit message conveying Mode S Comm B message data

field.name: BDS1
field.desc: Comm B Data Buffer Store 1 Address

field.name: BDS2
field.desc: Comm B Data Buffer Store 2 Address

subfield.desc:
NOTE
Only DAPs that can not be encoded into other subfields of this item should be sent using subfield #25

subfield.name: Barometric Pressure Setting (derived from Mode S BDS 4,0)
subfield.desc:
NOTE
BPS is the barometric pressure setting of the aircraft minus 800 mb.

dataitem.name: Flight Plan Related Data
dataitem.definition: All flight plan related information, provided by ground-based systems

subfield.name: FPPS Identification Tag
subfield.desc:
Note
The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int).

subfield.name: Callsign
subfield.desc:
Note
Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Callsign is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

subfield.name: Type of Aircraft
subfield.desc:
Note
1. Each of the four Octets composing the type of an aircraft contains an ASCII Character (upper-case alphabetic characters with trailing spaces).
2. The types of aircraft are defined in the ICAO Document 4444.

field.name: Wake Turbulence Category
field.desc: Wake Turbulence Category is an ASCII character code which should be one of the following values :

subfield.name: Departure Airport
subfield.desc:
Note
1. Each one of the four Octets composing the name of an airport contains an ASCII Character (upper case alphabetic).
2. The Airport Names are indicated in the ICAO Location Indicators book.

subfield.name: Destination Airport
subfield.desc:
Note
1. Each one of the four Octets composing the name of an airport contains an ASCII Character (upper case alphabetic).
2. The Airport Names are indicated in the ICAO Location Indicators book.

subfield.name: Runway Designation
subfield.desc:
Note
1. NU1, NU2 and LTR each contain an ASCII character
2. For details refer to ICAO Annex 14 Section 5

subfield.name: Current Control Position
subfield.desc:
Note
The centre and the control position identification codes have to be defined between communication partners.

subfield.name: Time of Departure
subfield.desc: NOTE - Estimated times are derived from flight plan systems. Predictedtimes are derived by the fusion system, based on surveillance data.

subfield.name: Aircraft Stand
subfield.desc:
Note
Each one of the six Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Aircraft Stand identification is always left adjusted. It contains up to six upper- case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

subfield.name: Standard Instrument Departure
subfield.desc:
Note
Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The SID is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

subfield.name: Standard Instrument Arrival
subfield.desc:
Note
Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The STAR is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.

subfield.name: Pre-Emergency Mode 3/A
subfield.desc:
Note
1. This subfield is used only when the aircraft is transmitting an emergency Mode 3/A code
2. If VA = 0, the content of bits 12/1 is meaningless

subfield.name: Pre-Emergency Callsign
subfield.desc:
Note
1. Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Callsign is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters.
2. This subfield is used only when en emergency Mode 3/A is associated with the track (I062/390 Subfield #17)

dataitem.name: Estimated Accuracies
dataitem.definition: Overview of all important accuracies

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Track Position (Cartesian)

field.name: APC (X-Component)
field.desc: Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated position of a target expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates.

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfield.name: XY covariance component

field.name: COV (XY Covariance Component)
field.desc: (COV) XY Covariance Component in two’s complement form (LSB) = 0.5m

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Track Position (WGS-84)

field.name: APW (Latitude Component)
field.desc: Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated position of a target expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates.

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Calculated Track Geometric Altitude

field.name: AGA
field.desc:
Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated geometric altitude of a target.
(LSB) = 1/4 FL

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Calculated Track Barometric Altitude

field.name: ABA
field.desc:
Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated barometric altitude of a target.
(LSB) = 0.25m/s

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Track Velocity (Cartesian)

field.name: ATV (X-Component)
field.desc: Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated track velocity in Cartesian co-ordinates.

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Acceleration (Cartesian)

field.name: AA
field.desc: Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated acceleration in Cartesian co-ordinates

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

subfield.name: Estimated Accuracy Of Rate Of Climb/Descent

field.name: ARC
field.desc:
Estimated accuracy (i.e. standard deviation) of the calculated rate of Climb/Descent of an aircraft.
(LSB) = 6.25 feet/minute

subfield.desc:
Note
Maximum value means maximum value or above.

dataitem.name: Composed Track Number
dataitem.definition: Identification of a system track
dataitem.desc:
Note
The composed track number is used by co-operating units to uniquely identify a track. It consists of the unit identifier and system track number for each unit involved in the co-operation. The first unit identification identifies the unit that is responsible for the track amalgamation.
